channel.title: "Wishes to trade with you" instead of "[name] wishes to trade with you" [PI]
channel.description: I was looking through all the source files and couldn't find anything. Then in the client, I found it. But, how do I make it say name? I tried +c.playerName+ but it didn't work.

item.title: "Wishes to trade with you" instead of "[name] wishes to trade with you" [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Mr_x1 Mr...x..
item.description:
@Mr_x1 wrote:

[code] case 253:
String s = inStream.readString();
if(s.startsWith(“Alert##”)) {
String[] args = s.split("##");
if (args.length == 3) {
alertHandler.alert = new Alert(“Notification”, args[1], args[2]);
} else if (args.length == 4) {
alertHandler.alert = new Alert(args[1], args[2], args[3]);
}
pktType = -1;
return true;
}
if(s.toLowerCase().contains(“oh dear you are dead!”)) {
if(orbToggle[1]) {
turnOffPrayers();
turnOffCurses();
orbToggle[1] = false;
}
}
if(s.toLowerCase().contains("@autocastoff")) {
setAutoCastOff();
break;
}
if(s.toLowerCase().contains(“you have been poisoned”)) {
orbToggle[0] = true;
}
if(s.toLowerCase().contains(“you are no longer poisoned”) || s.toLowerCase().contains(“your antipoison potion”) || s.toLowerCase().contains(“antidote”)) {
System.out.println(“s: " + s);
orbToggle[0] = false;
}
if(s.endsWith(”:tradereq:")) {
String s3 = s.substring(0, s.indexOf(":"));
long l17 = TextClass.longForName(s3);
boolean flag2 = false;
for(int j27 = 0; j27 < ignoreCount; j27++) {
if(ignoreListAsLongs[j27] != l17)
continue;
flag2 = true;

					}
					if(!flag2 && anInt1251 == 0)
						pushMessage("wishes to trade with you.", 4, s3);
				} else if (s.endsWith(":clan:")) {
					String s4 = s.substring(0, s.indexOf(":"));
					long l18 = TextClass.longForName(s4);
					pushMessage("Clan: ", 8, s4);	
				} else if(s.endsWith("#url#")) {
					String link = s.substring(0, s.indexOf("#"));
					pushMessage("Join us at: ", 9, link);
				} else if(s.startsWith("#010#")) {
					shoutYell = s.substring(5);
					nameYell = "";
					if(s.contains("@cr1@"))
						nameYell = "1";
					if(s.contains("@cr2@"))
						nameYell = "2";
						
					pushMessage(shoutYell, 16, nameYell);

[/code]
///
I’ve looked at some other PI’s, and both client.java(client) and tradeandduel.java(server) look the same. I have no idea what to do now…
/////
Simple Fix: myPlayer.name.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Mr_x1 Mr...x..
item.description:
@Mr_x1 wrote:

[quote=“team boy, post:17, topic:442805”][quote author=Mr…x… link=topic=545492.msg3998450#msg3998450 date=1337616936]

idk

just do this…(server side)

Open client.java and search for this line. textDrawingArea.drawBasicString(chatMessages[k], 11, yPos+paddingY, 0x800080, -1);

and replace it with textDrawingArea.drawBasicString(s1 + " "+ chatMessages[k], 11, yPos + paddingY, 0x800080, -1);

There is no such thing in my client class
[/quote]

(server side)

client.java[/quote]
Yes, I know.
You already told me this, but it isn’t server sided, I know this.

And imsuperman05,

o.sendMessage(Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) + ":tradereq:");
didn't work. This is what it was in the beginning.

/////

I can see the problem… the c.playername isn’t in " 's… right? So how would you make it like that…

o.sendMessage(""+c.playerName+" :tradereq:");?

[quote=“team boy, post:13, topic:442805”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=545492.msg3998441#msg3998441 date=1337615785]

go to client.java

look for

you will see something like this

if(!flag2 && anInt1251 == 0) pushMessage("wishes to trade with you.", 4, s3);

make it

if(!flag2 && anInt1251 == 0) pushMessage(" " + c.playerName + " wishes to trade with you.", 4, s3);

no that wouldnt work

change it to
o.sendMessage(Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) + “:tradereq:”);
[/quote]
no that wont work it needs to be
pushMessage

try this

Open client.java and search for this line. textDrawingArea.drawBasicString(chatMessages[k], 11, yPos+paddingY, 0x800080, -1);

and replace it with textDrawingArea.drawBasicString(s1 + " "+ chatMessages[k], 11, yPos + paddingY, 0x800080, -1);[/quote]

item.title: "Wishes to trade with you" instead of "[name] wishes to trade with you" [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Mr_x1 Mr...x..
item.description:
@Mr_x1 wrote:

c.sendMessage(" " + c.playerName + " Sending trade request...");
^Isn't that stating that the person sending out the request will receive: (lets say his name is danny) "Danny Sending trade request..." Which is not what I want, I want the person receiving the trade-request to say who it is that send him it.

My problem, if there is a bunch of people all in a small area, and someone trades someone, it will just say “wishes to trade with you”, so he wont know who it is.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @team_boy team boy
item.description:
@team_boy wrote:

Search for:

Change it to this

[code] } else if(!c.inTrade) {

			c.tradeRequested = true;
			c.sendMessage(" " + c.playerName + " Sending trade request...");
			o.sendMessage(Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) + ":tradereq:");
		}
	} 
	catch (Exception e) {
		Misc.println("Error requesting trade.");
	}
}[/code]

or this

Open client.java and search for this line. textDrawingArea.drawBasicString(chatMessages[k], 11, yPos+paddingY, 0x800080, -1);

and replace it with textDrawingArea.drawBasicString(s1 + " "+ chatMessages[k], 11, yPos + paddingY, 0x800080, -1);
